Full display: Other details > (physical description cluster) > Accompanying material:

definition: Creator and selected contributor names for narrowing down search results

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: Other names known (from relator term/code) to be authors/creators. These would be 2nd authors, etc.

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: Other names known (from relator term/code) to be contributors to the work. These would be illustrators, cast members, etc.

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: In cataloging terms, the "main entry" author---the primary author that is recorded in a 1xx field. By definition, this should be a creator of the work described
rationale: Was separate in Endeca, some UIs displayed this author field, when available, in the brief record display. Copied/re-used to create work_citation

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: The role of the creator_main name in relation to the work described
rationale: Should be displayed, but not included in index/facet value.

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: Other names with relator term/codes that are currently uncategorized or in the "other" category as to role. These are expected to be minor roles and should be displayed/ranked lower than authors[contrib]

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed
definition: Undifferentiated names known (with no relator term/code) Due to legacy data, should display beneath authors[added]

provisional: y - data model pattern decision needed
y - data model pattern decision needed

definition: Binary (Available/Not available) value for Availability facet
Array of item barcode values associated with/attached to bib record.
rationale: Support staff use
implementation details: Pull barcode value from each item record and write it to an array in top-level field

definition: Number of concurrent users (for a licensed e-resource)
rationale: Was in development (for prominent display and faceting) in Endeca when that project was frozen. Was considered important by at least UNC and Duke. UNC did extensive work to code this accurately and consistently in all ebook records.
implementation details: Should be NUMBER. This number can be mapped to a textual statement for display in the UI

Full display: Other details > (item/copy-specific description cluster) > Description of this copy or version:
definition: Information that distinguishes the copy(s) or version(s) of materials when more than one copy or version exists or could exist.
rationale: Support identification/selection of resources
notes: Institutions may want to push notes from locally defined data sources to this element

definition: The digits-only value from 264 field coded as copyright date
Date that record was fully cataloged/completed. If this specific date is not available from the system, you could use a record creation date instead. DO NOT map a "record updated" date to this field.
rationale: Subject librarians use this facet, combined with call number range, to produce/link to lists of newly available materials of interest to users
implementation details: Transform to standard date format; map to desired date ranges (last week, last month, etc)

Full display: Related items > Items based on this one:
definition: Free text note describing works based on the use, study, or analysis of the materials described in the record. Indexed because 7XX entries are generally not created for the publications listed here.
Director of film/video
rationale: Used in UNC FilmFinder. Important access point for discovering film/video.
notes: No separate director_relator field because "director" is the known relator here. (<--revisit in light of names with multiple relators. See fields_issues tab) "Directors and Performers" facet in UNC FilmFinder is the Author facet (dim=10), relabeled.

definition: Name of material donor.
rationale: Important for donor relations. In the future, could be used to generate "digital bookplate"

definition: Edition statement
rationale: Identify and select items

definition: Editor of the described resource
rationale: Not supposed to be recorded as a main creator/author in a catalog record, however is used as filing/entry name in many citation styles. Recorded in a separate field, when possible, for use in improved citation builder features
notes: No separate editor_relator field because editor is the known relator here (<-- Revisit since there can be multiple relators on a name)

definition: Current frequency of continuing resource
Former frequency (or frequencies) of continuing resource
Pre-coordinate genre/form headings
rationale: Display in record (in order); adaptive hyperlinking for browsing/exploring; feed into autosuggest and/or "related titles" features?

definition: Array of holdings elements, each representing a holdings record attached to the bib. Each holdings element is an an escaped JSON string

Brief display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Call Number column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
Full display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Call Number column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
definition: Full call number from holdings record (classification number + shelving cutter + shelf marks + volume/copy designators)
rationale: Obtain resource

definition: Unique identifier for source data holdings record in host institution's ILS.
rationale: Of possible use for requesting or other features;;;UNC uses this to link to "Latest Received" display from our Sierra OPAC

Brief display: no label -- translated into display value -- highlighted broader location row
Full display: no label -- translated into display value -- highlighted broader location row
definition: Broad location: Library building/branch/larger location in which the shelving location is found
rationale: Inform user what library building or main section/area to go to in order to find the items covered by holdings statement
implementation details: ILS code. Do not translate to human-readable label in MARC-to-Argot

Brief display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Location column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
Full display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Location column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
definition: Narrow location: Area of library, shelving location, etc. code for items covered by the holdings statement
rationale: Inform user what section/area of stacks to go to in order to find the items covered by holdings statement
implementation details: ILS code. Do not translate to human-readable label in MARC-to-Argot

definition: Public notes from the holdings record
rationale: Provide information on the run/span of items described that cannot be recorded elsewhere in holdings record.

Brief display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Status column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
Full display: no label -- translated into display value --  in Status column in bolded (but not highlighted) narrower location row
definition: For serials (and for some institutions, monographic series or sets), statement indicating what the library/location has for the title (volumes/years held, gaps, etc)
rationale: See what the library/location has without having to look through all the individual items/volumes
implementation details: While there will be only 1 'summary' element per 'holding' hash within the 'holdings' array, multiple summary statements may be concatenated into that 'summary' element. In this case, keep the concatenated values in original record order.

Full display: Other details > (ids cluster) > TRLN Discovery Record ID:
definition: Local ID with institution or other code prepended, creating unique value in TRLN Discovery system
rationale: Used in full record URL, is Solr document id, etc.

definition: Main publication statement, or the closest we can get to that. Where there's a single 260/264, we use that. Where there are multiple, we try to find the best one. Refer to documentation linked from here for details on that.
rationale: In search results/brief record, we want to show succinct publication info, ideally that which should be used when citing the item.
notes: Is not displayed in full record if there is an imprint_multiple field

definition: Label qualifying the value of field (i.e. part of resource or time span in resource's history to which the information applies)
rationale: Displayed to contextualize the rest of the data in the field

definition: The type of data recorded in the field (publication, distribution, production, manufacture)
rationale: When value is NOT 'publication,' may be used to generate display label
notes: Is not displayed if value is "Imprint",  "Publication", or "Copyright". Otherwise displays at beginnning of field data: "Distributed:", "Produced:", "Manufactured:"

definition: The text of the publication, etc statement
rationale: Displayed

definition: When there is more than one 260/264, records the data from all of them, retaining MARC record order. Includes the value extracted for use in imprint_main.
rationale: Show full publication, etc info in details section. This can be helpful in verifying the desired item has been found. It's impossible to 100% know we've chosen the imprint_main value accurately, and all the data recorded in the bib record appears on the resource (or did at some point in time, so may be considered important for description/identification of resource
notes: If this field exists, it is displayed in full record instead of imprint_main

definition: Label qualifying the value of field (i.e. part of resource or time span in resource's history to which the information applies)
rationale: Displayed to contextualize the rest of the data in the field

definition: The type of data recorded in the field (publication, distribution, production, manufacture)
rationale: When value is NOT 'publication,' may be used to generate display label
notes: Is not displayed if value is "Imprint",  "Publication", or "Copyright". Otherwise displays at beginnning of field data: "Distributed:", "Produced:", "Manufactured:"

definition: The text of the publication, etc statement
rationale: Displayed

definition: Author elements from Syndetics ICE TOC data, enhanced coded MARC 505, or other source
rationale: Searchable, but not displayed.
endeca equivalent: Table of Contents author index;;;ICE Chapter Author

definition: Title elements from Syndetics ICE TOC data, enhanced coded MARC 505, or other source
rationale: Searchable, but not displayed.

definition: Included works not handled in a more specific field such as Table of Contents
rationale: Navigation/exploration of catalog
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

definition: Institution housing/maintaining (physical) or having access to (electronic, shared print) resource described by record
rationale: Use to determine what records show in an filtered-to-institution display

definition: ISBN data for use in display, index, and syndetics_id
rationale: Search. Syndetics match point

definition: ISBN field(s) to display
rationale: See discussion at https://trlnmain.atlassian.net/browse/TD-372

definition: Brief description of part, format, version the ISBN refers to
ISSN associated with resource described by record

note on display: Type values include: ISSN, ISSN-L, ISSN-L (canceled), ISSN (incorrect), ISSN (canceled)
definition: Type of ISSN, determined by which 022 subfield it is recorded in
rationale: Accurate labeling of value

definition: The ISSN value
Array of item elements, each representing an item record attached to the bib. Each item element is an an escaped JSON string
Full call number from item record (classification number + shelving cutter + shelf marks + volume/copy designators)
rationale: Obtain resource; sort items in display into a logical order

definition: Scheme (LCC, DDC, NLM, SUDOC, etc) from which item_call_number was assigned
rationale: Support/control features behind the scenes -- gives info on further processing of this info into other fields

definition: Copy number
rationale: Differentiate multiple copies of the same volume. Sort items?

Brief display: Item list> Status column (if checked out)
Full display: Item list> Status column (if checked out)
definition: Item due date
rationale: Can be shown as part of item status if item checked out
notes: Only populated if item status = Checked out

definition: Unique identifier for an item record in host institution's ILS. Could be record number or barcode.
rationale: Of possible use for requesting or other features

Brief display: Item list > (mapped to display value) > bold in highlighted row
Full display: Item list > (mapped to display value) > bold in highlighted row
definition: Broad location: Library building/branch/larger location in which the shelving location is found
rationale: Inform user what library building or main section/area to go to in order to find the item
implementation details: ILS code. Do not translate to human-readable label in MARC-to-Argot

Brief display: Item list > (mapped to display value) > unhighlighted row
Full display: Item list > (mapped to display value) > unhighlighted row
definition: Narrow location: Area of library, shelving location code for item
rationale: Inform user what section/area of stacks to go to in order to find the item
implementation details: ILS code. Do not translate to human-readable label in MARC-to-Argot

definition: Public notes from the item record
rationale: Provide specific information at the copy or volume level. Assist in select and obtain user tasks
implementation details: An item may have more than one item note. They should be displayed in order.

definition: Status of individual item
rationale: Shows user whether item is available, library use only, checked out (and when due), missing, etc. Feeds into bib availability value
implementation details: Output human-readable status. Institution-specific status messages are output at item level. These will be mapped to a standardized, central set of broader "status" categories for use outside individual item display

definition: Type/format for individual item
Volume indicator/designator
rationale: Tell volumes of serials/sets/etc apart. Sort items?

definition: Language(s) of the content in the material(s) described by the record
rationale: Limit/narrow results by language. Many resources are in more than one language. Users studying languages should be able to find materials that are in "English and French" ;;; Display language names in record
implementation details: Map language codes to preferred language terms for display (if not storage/indexing) -- http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/languages.html or http://www.loc.gov/standards/codelists/languages.xml ;;; Retain order because 008 language code is the "main" or first language in the item; in 041, codes are assigned in order of importance/amount of content

definition: Higher-level (library, etc.) locations housing volumes/copies of the resource described in the bib record
rationale: Support for abstract, polyhierarchical location facet. Facet limits/excludes BIB records.

definition: Various IDs from MARC records (EAN, CODEN, Publisher numbers, etc).
rationale: There are MANY possible ID types, many of which are only relevant for certain formats or disciplines. Make a general use IDs field so these can be searched and displayed, without having to define every ID type separately.

definition: Qualifying information for the id
rationale: Info useful for understanding the ID and what it refers to

definition: Type of ID
rationale: Label for the id in display. Also maybe used in individual UIs to filter some IDs out of the display

definition: Value of ID
rationale: x

note on display: Considered important to display prominently, especially for e-resources.
definition: Note about access restrictions or lack thereof
rationale: May want to show more prominently than other notes, given that the resource may not be accessible to some users

definition: Intial label portion of note
rationale: x

definition: Displayed note value
rationale: x

Full display: Other details > (item/copy-specific description cluster) > Source of acquisition:
definition: Information about the immediate source of acquisition of the described materials and is used primarily with original or historical items, or other archival collections.
rationale: UNC puts important notes about donors, etc here that need to be displayed in public catalog
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.;;;Display only. Send indexed portions to note_index;;;Sent to metadata folks at Duke and NCSU on 2018-02-28 (TRLN Discovery: feedback on some notes fields); heard from Sonoe that "NCSU doesn't do much with the 541"

rationale: x

rationale: x

Designation of an academic dissertation or thesis and the institution to which it was presented.q
rationale: Structured this way to make it consistent with other note processing into Solr

definition: All displayed notes not included in a more specific field, kept in catalog record order, with labels provided
rationale: x

definition: Whether the note value should be indexed. If not explicitly set to false, assume true.
rationale: x

definition: Note content that will be indexed, populated only if different from [value]
rationale: x

definition: Intial label portion of note
rationale: x

definition: Displayed note value. Will be indexed if [indexed] is not false and [indexed_value] is not set.
rationale: x

note on display: Show beneath whatever is shown for "Published:" Note should be self-explanatory when seen in this context
definition: Information about materials issued with the described resource, or issuing body of the described resource
rationale: Includes textual notes on mode of issuance (closely related or synonymous with publication) or those responsible for issuance

definition: Designation of an academic dissertation or thesis and the institution to which it was presented.q

Full display: Other details > (physical description cluster) > (no label/self labeled)
definition: Description of the material in the resource described. Scale, frame rate, etc.
rationale: Structured this way to make it consistent with other note processing into Solr

definition: Information about the participants, players, narrators, presenters, or performers.
The value of the note
Optional contextualizing label for note
Credits for persons or organizations, other than members of the cast, who have participated in the creation and/or production of the work.
The value of the note
Information about the participants, players, narrators, presenters, or performers.

Full display: Other details > (physical description cluster) > (no label/self labeled)
definition: Information about the participants, players, narrators, presenters, or performers.

note on display: If Syndetics summary is available, it is displayed. If not, and note_summary is populated, it is displayed.
definition: Summary note from source record. Indexed, but will not be displayed if there is a Syndetics Summary available

Full display: Other details > (physical description cluster) > System details:
definition: Technical information about an item and the requirements for using it

note on display: If Syndetics TOC data is available, it is displayed. If not, and note_toc is populated, it is displayed.
definition: Contents note from source record. Indexed, but will not be displayed if there is a Syndetics TOC
"With" note. Note indicating that more than one bibliographical work is contained in the physical item at the time of publishing, release, issue, or execution
Value of the note
rationale: Structured this way to make it consistent with other note processing into Solr

definition: Hash containing different OCLC number elements
OCLC record numbers of no-longer-existing WorldCat master records that were merged into this record
rationale: OCLC merges records all the time. If you have the OCLC number of a merged/deleted record, you should be able to be able to find the current record if it's in the system. Possibly improve rollup performance down the road.
implementation details: Digits only. Strip off ocn/ocm/on prefixes. If coming from 035z, remove (OCoLC)

Full display: Other details > (ids cluster) > OCLC WorldCat record ID:
definition: OCLC record number
implementation details: Digits only. Strip off ocn/ocm/on prefixes. If coming from 035, remove (OCoLC)

definition: Physical description of the described item, including its extent, dimensions, and such other physical details as a description of any accompanying materials and unit type and size.
rationale: Assist in identification/selection of resources in catalog

definition: Indexed publisher, distributor, etc. name
rationale: x

note on display: Facet would be accessible in Admin/Backend interface only.
definition: Data source(s) for record
rationale: Invaluable for doing data work/troubleshooting. Supported in Endeca: http://trlnr610c.trln.org:8888/endeca_jspref/controller.jsp?sid=13704A964F65&enePort=8070&Ne=206582&eneHost=trlnr610c.trln.org&N=0
implementation details: Values: ILSMARC, DC, EAD, ICE, Shared:#{Name/code of shared record set};;;Multiple values required because a final record in the system may mainly come from ILSMARC, but also be Shared, or have data merged in from EAD or ICE.

definition: Related works not handled in a more specific field
rationale: Navigation/exploration of catalog
endeca equivalent: Translation of Linking;;;Translated as Linking;;;Has Supplement Linking;;;Supplement to Linking;;;Other Edition;;;Name Title
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

definition: Notes describing related resources
Namespaced ID used for rolling up records in "Expand to TRLN" mode.
rationale: Avoid showing duplicate records when multiple institutions have the same title

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: Controlled/authorized form of heading (or at least form that refers to a title/work described separatately)
rationale: Best way for users to navigate to all books in the same series held by the libraries

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: Author portion of series entry, if applicable
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: Other details from the field (volume designation of this item, etc)
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: ISSN for the series
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: Contextualizing label for data in the field
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

Full display: Related items > Other items in this series:
definition: Series title
notes: Details of Argot mapping still need to be finalized.

definition: Transcribed series statement
rationale: This is what appears on the item itself, but it may not provide good/consistent results for searching in the catalog

definition: Indexed ISSNs from transcribed series fields
rationale: ISSNS for display are included in series_transcribed. This makes those ISSNs searchable in the ids index

Full display: Other details > (ids cluster) > SerialsSolutions record number:
definition: SerialsSolutions record ID number. Begins with ssj or ssib
rationale: Rollup for SerialsSolutions titles.

Full display: Other details > (item/copy-specific description cluster) > Description of special binding:
definition: Binding information intended primarily for use with antiquarian materials, rare books and other special collections.
rationale: Full description of rare materials

definition: List of authors and other contributors, typically transcribed from title page. In legacy records, may contain other data from the 245 field that has not been subfielded by one of the other subfield codes.
Chronological/time period terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual chronological terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

definition: Genre/form terms
rationale: Explode subject and genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual genre/form terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated genre terms from different vocabularies separately. I'll be making a case to POs that it's necessary to include terms from several non-LCSH vocabularies in this facet to make it at all useful.

definition: Geographic/region terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual geographic terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

definition: Topical terms from Library of Congress Subject Headings (LCSH)
rationale: Explode subject headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual topical terms
notes: field_name includes "lcsh" because in Endeca, we also have a Medical Subject headings topic facet -- erring on the side of being more specific earlier on, based on Luke's advice that it'd be easier to generalize things later on than to tease out lost specifics;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

definition: Pre-coordinate subject headings
rationale: Display in record (in order); adaptive hyperlinking for browsing/exploring; feed into autosuggest and/or "related titles" features

note on display: No additional label should be required. Field data typically makes sense on its own.
definition: Note (publication info, notes, etc) about title former note etry
Structured title or name/title entry for former title of the described resource, where former title is described in separate catalog record
rationale: Exploration/navigation of catalog

definition: Former and later titles to index but not display
rationale: Index because they are in a controlled/structured format. Do not display because the MARC field is coded as do not display, probably because it duplicates data elsewhere in the record which IS going to display (probably in a note).

definition: ISBN associated with former or later title
ISSN associated with former or later title
Former and later titles to index but not display
Structured title or name/title entry for later title of the described resource, where later title is described in separate catalog record
rationale: Exploration/navigation of catalog

definition: Main title, excluding any initial articles
Main title, including any initial articles

note on display: Display under main title? If label is required, MARC standard suggests: "Title translated: "
definition: Translation of the title statement that is made by the cataloging agency when the translated title does not appear as a parallel title on the item.
Statement of responsibility portion of field
Title proper portion of field
Variant titles that are coded for display in the catalog record
rationale: Some variant titles are quite different, so it'd be best for the user to see why the record was retrieved for their search
endeca equivalent: Journal Title Abbreviation;;;Title Index;;;Journal Varying Title;;;Varying Titles

definition: Variant titles (including key titles and abbreviated titles) that should be indexed but not displayed
rationale: Some variant titles are so similar as to be basically redundant. It's not informative to users to show the specific abbreviated titles and key titles that appear in MARC records, but if they search for these (for example, by pasting in a citation that uses an abbreviated title format) they should be able to retrieve the title
endeca equivalent: Journal Title Abbreviation;;;Title Index;;;Journal Varying Title;;;Varying Titles
notes: High relevance because these are other forms of name for the exact thing described by the record

definition: Universal product code
rationale: x

definition: Universal product code. Qualifying info only
rationale: Contextualizes the recorded UPC
implementation details: If no qualifying info is given for a UPC in a record, this MUST be set to ""

definition: Universal product code. Indexed numeric portion
rationale: Syndetics API data match point. Possible search term

Full display: Depends on url[rel] value. Documentation will clarify this
endeca equivalent: Finding Aid URL;;;Primary URL;;;Repository URL;;;Secondary URL;;;Thumbnail URL

definition: Type of access: open or restricted
rationale: Involved in logic for displaying URLs when expanded to TRLN

Full display: Depends on url[rel] value. Documentation will clarify this
definition: The actual URL
rationale: Target location of hyperlink

definition: URL relator, or type of URL
rationale: Different types of URLs need to be displayed in different parts of the record and/or labeled differently

Full display: Depends on url[rel] value. Documentation will clarify this
definition: Link text
rationale: The text that will be made into a clickable hyperlink pointing to the url[href] value

note on display: Index, but don't display. Users don't care about vendor MARC record ids, but this is potentially a useful thing for staff to search on
definition: MARC record control number assigned by source other than OCLC
rationale: Staff search, possibly of use for rolling up e-resources or other format records, if institutions use the same MARC record source

definition: Collection/group names searchable but not displayed anywhere. Can be used to scope special searches, power various logic, etc.
rationale: Needed by institutions.

definition: Entry created from preferred form of main author/creator name (if applicable) and preferred form of title.
rationale: Retrieve/collocate works where title has been recorded differently on separate versions (different language title, wording/spelling changed, etc., works with many versions, etc.)
notes: This should definitely be a separate searchable string in the title index, but unsure whether it needs to be displayed on its own -- it will be part of the work_citation field which is probably more suitable for display

definition: Preferred form of creator name, if present.
notes: NOT INDEXED as author because, if the source data for this element exist, it will already be mapped to the indexed fields authors[main] and author_facet

definition: Preferred title of work/expression
endeca equivalent: Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title

definition: Name/title entry created from main author (if present) and title proper portion of 245
rationale: Entry in the form that other records will use to refer to this specific manifestation (or this work, if no alternate preferred form of title has been established)
